Description: Wooden box, made from wood and painted black, white, red and yellow, perhaps to imitate boxes made of more precious materials (ivory, ebony, faience, precious metals). The box is provided with four legs, and two knobs (on the lid and an adjacent side) to allow fastening with a cord. The decorative motif includes line, petal and dot decoration with intervening/framing bands of yellow and red, and representations of vases at each corner. Inside the box, the space is divided into four compartments, two of which contained filled bags, when found.
Curator's comments: For a range of New Kingdom boxes, see Killen, Ancient Egyptian Furniture II (1994).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
